text:
## What is this project?

This assistant is part of the Master‚Äôs Thesis (TFM) of **Gregorio Bl√°zquez Mart√≠nez** (author of this project).  
It combines **predictive models (ARIMA)** with **retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)** on official tourism documents (INE reports such as FRONTUR and EGATUR, and complementary materials).

The goal is to explore how AI can help **analyze, explain and forecast tourism trends in Spain**.
title: Project FAQs

text:
## Is the data official or generated?

- **Official data**: When referring to FRONTUR, EGATUR or other INE reports, the assistant retrieves real numbers and text from official sources.  
- **Generated data**: Predictions or explanations outside the reports are created using AI models trained with historical series. These are **estimates, not official figures**.
title: Project FAQs

text:
## How can I use the assistant?

You can ask two types of questions:

- **Document-based**: ‚ÄúSummarize the last FRONTUR report‚Äù, ‚ÄúWhat is the average spending according to EGATUR?‚Äù.  
- **Prediction-based**: ‚ÄúHow many tourists are expected in Spain in August 2025?‚Äù, ‚ÄúForecast for Canarias in 2026‚Äù.  

The assistant will decide whether to search documents (**RAG**) or use predictive models (**API**).
title: Project FAQs

text:
## Can I trust the answers?

- For **official numbers and report summaries**, yes ‚Äî they come directly from INE documents.  
- For **forecasts**, treat them as **projections** based on statistical models, not as guaranteed outcomes.
title: Project FAQs

text:
### üîπ Variables in `elevado_eg_mod_web_tur_*.txt` (trips) | Variable | Type | Values / Example | Description | |----------------|----------|-------------------|-------------| | `mm_aaaa` | string | `0123` | Reference month and year (MMYY). | | `A0` | string | `2` | Survey source (2 = Egatur). | | `A0_1` | string | `20200200009238` | **Unique identifier** of the questionnaire (primary key for joins). | | `A0_7` | string | `2`, `8` | Tourist type:
‚Ä¢ 2 = Non-resident (non-transit)
‚Ä¢ 8 = Non-resident in transit. | | `A1` | string | `1-4` | Exit route:
1 = Road, 2 = Airport, 3 = Port, 4 = Train. | | `pais` | string | `01-15` | Country of residence:
01 = Germany, 02 = Belgium, ‚Ä¶, 15 = Rest of the world. | | `ccaa` | string | `01-19` | Main destination Autonomous Community (region):
01 = Andalusia, ‚Ä¶, 19 = Melilla. | | `A13` | integer | `3` | Total overnight stays in the trip. | | `aloja` | string | `1-3` | Main accommodation type:
1 = Hotels and similar, 2 = Other market, 3 = Non-market. | | `motivo` | string | `1-3` | Main trip purpose:
1 = Leisure/holidays, 2 = Business, 3 = Other. | | `A16` | string | `1`, `6` | Package tour: 1 = Yes, 6 = No. | | `gastototal` | decimal | `2341.84` | Total expenditure of the trip/excursion. | | `factoregatur` | decimal | `1998.09` | Expansion factor (sampling weight). | **Methodological notes:** - **Estimated tourist expenditure** = `gastototal * factoregatur`. - **Number of tourists** = sum of `factoregatur`. - **Estimated overnight stays** = `A13 * factoregatur`. - **Daily average expenditure** = total expenditure / estimated overnight stays. - **Average trip length** = estimated overnight stays / tourists.
title: EGATUR egatur_dictionary

text:
# EGATUR ‚Äì Key Insights (EDA)

- **Trip length vs. spending:** Longer trips ‚Üí lower daily expenditure. Short trips ‚Üí high-intensity spenders.
- **Regional concentration:** 6 regions account for most trips: Catalonia, Balearic Islands, Andalusia, Canary Islands, Valencia, Madrid.
- **Country effects:** Tourists from Russia & Rest of the World spend significantly more per day.
- **Outliers:** High spenders differ by metric (total, weighted, daily). Extreme trips are not consistent across measures.
- **Clusters:** Segmentation shows clear differences in purpose, accommodation, and geography.

# EGATUR ‚Äì Tourist Clusters (EDA)

Based on clustering analysis of EGATUR microdata (2022‚Äì2025), four main tourist profiles were identified:

1. **Cluster 0 ‚Äì Long-stay visitors in the Valencian Community**
   - Longer trips, medium-to-low daily expenditure.
   - Non-market accommodation common.
   - Mix of leisure and personal purposes.

2. **Cluster 1 ‚Äì Standard tourists (Island vacationers)**
   - Balearic & Canary Islands, hotels.
   - Mostly summer leisure trips.

3. **Cluster 2 ‚Äì Personal/family visits**
   - Long stays, non-market accommodation.
   - Purpose: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù (visiting relatives, personal reasons).
   - Spread across multiple regions.

4. **Cluster 3 ‚Äì Urban, high-spending international tourists**
   - Catalonia & Madrid.
   - Hotels, short stays, high daily expenditure.
   - Mix of leisure and business.
   - Higher share of Russia + Rest of the World.
title: EGATUR egatur_EDA

Nota metodol√≥gica
El objetivo principal de la Encuesta de Gasto Tur√≠stico (EGATUR) es obtener informaci√≥n mensual del gasto
tur√≠stico realizado por visitantes no residentes en Espa√±a en sus viajes a nuestro pa√≠s. Para su elaboraci√≥n
se siguen las definiciones y recomendaciones de la ONU Turismo y EUROSTAT.
estad√≠stica continua de periodicidad mensual.

text:
# EGATUR ‚Äì Predictive Models

## Cluster Classifier
- Neural network trained to replicate EDA clusters.
- Accuracy >99%.
- Assigns new tourist profiles to one of 4 clusters.

## Expenditure Regressor
- HistGradientBoosting model predicts daily average expenditure.
- Key predictors:
  - **Trip length** (negative exponential effect).
  - **Country of origin** (Russia/Rest of the World = +200‚Ç¨/day).
- Minor factors: accommodation, region.
- Negligible: purpose, season.

## Explainability
- SHAP values show how features affect predictions.
- Transparency: can explain both global patterns and individual cases.
title: EGATUR egatur_models

Nota metodol√≥gica
El objetivo principal de la Estad√≠stica de Movimientos Tur√≠sticos en Fronteras (FRONTUR) es estimar
mensualmente el n√∫mero de visitantes no residentes en Espa√±a que llegan a nuestro pa√≠s, as√≠ como
title: FRONTUR 2025-06

text:
El objetivo principal de la Estad√≠stica de Movimientos Tur√≠sticos en Fronteras (FRONTUR) es estimar
mensualmente el n√∫mero de visitantes no residentes en Espa√±a que llegan a nuestro pa√≠s, as√≠ como
conocer las caracter√≠sticas principales de los viajes que realizan esos visitantes. Para la elaboraci√≥n de
FRONTUR se siguen las definiciones y recomendaciones internacionales de la ONU Turismo y de
EUROSTAT en esta materia.
estad√≠stica continua de periodicidad mensual.
se refiere a los no residentes en Espa√±a que entran a nuestro pa√≠s, hayan o no
pernoctado, as√≠ como a los que pasan por nuestro pa√≠s en tr√°nsito.
todo el territorio nacional, la muestra se recoge en los principales puntos de acceso de
los viajeros no residentes, tanto en carretera, aeropuertos, puertos y ferrocarril.
mes.
el tama√±o muestral te√≥rico anual de FRONTUR supera las 450.000 encuestas, que se
reparten a lo largo del a√±o, teniendo en cuenta la estacionalidad de los flujos de viajeros.
title: FRONTUR 2025-06

text:
mes.
el tama√±o muestral te√≥rico anual de FRONTUR supera las 450.000 encuestas, que se
reparten a lo largo del a√±o, teniendo en cuenta la estacionalidad de los flujos de viajeros.
para cada v√≠a se definen estratos que agrupan puntos fronterizos, aeropuertos, puertos
o l√≠neas ferroviarias. En la afijaci√≥n muestral de carretera y aeropuerto se distingue adem√°s el d√≠a de la
semana en el que se realizan las encuestas, diferenciando los d√≠as laborables de los fines de semana y
festivos. En aeropuertos se definen 21 relaciones a√©reas (aeropuerto espa√±ol de origen-pa√≠s del aeropuerto
de destino).
la recogida de informaci√≥n se realiza por entrevista directa cuando el viajero
abandona Espa√±a, mediante cuestionario electr√≥nico multiling√ºe.
Para m√°s informaci√≥n se puede tener acceso a la metodolog√≠a y al informe metodol√≥gico estandarizado.
